summary: REQ-3 focuses on fixing the failed deployment so that a standard IC build/deploy succeeds (backend + frontend) and, if it fails, logs pinpoint the failing step. The diff shows only frontend UI/component changes (App, AdminEditor, error state) and a project metadata update; it does not show any changes that directly address dfx build/deploy, backend Motoko compilation, canister init traps, or deployment-step logging.

missing_requirements.requirement: Identify and fix the cause of the failed deployment, ensuring the project builds and deploys successfully using the standard Internet Computer workflow (backend canister + frontend assets).
missing_requirements.reason: The diff contains only frontend component/UI changes and project metadata. There is no evidence of changes to the backend canister (Motoko), dfx configuration/build pipeline, or any deployment-related scripts/config that would fix a dfx deploy failure end-to-end.

missing_requirements.requirement: If the deployment fails again, surface the exact failing step and error output in logs so it is actionable to fix.
missing_requirements.reason: The only logging evidence shown is runtime console error logging in a frontend error component; there is no evidence of build/deploy-step logging (e.g., dfx command output capture, CI logs, or script instrumentation) that would surface the exact failing deployment step.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/expanded frontend runtime error UI with retry/refresh flows (LiveContentErrorState) and Toaster usage.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-3 is about fixing build/deploy failure; the diff shows new/changed end-user UI behavior that is not explicitly requested as part of the deployment fix, and does not demonstrate addressing the underlying dfx deploy/build failure.

hallucinated_features.description: Admin editor functionality updates (draft load/save/publish UI patterns, image selection list, dialogs/tabs) beyond deployment-failure remediation.
hallucinated_features.reason: The build requestâ€™s non-goals exclude adding unrelated product features; the diff indicates expanded editor/UI behavior that is not clearly tied to fixing the deployment/build failure itself.
